results.title: An Interview with Douglas McLean
results.creator_credit: Douglas McLean and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Douglas McLean tells of how he was called up when war was declared and his posting to the 39th Brigade. He covers his years of service as well as fighting the Japanese in the Pacific.
results.description: Douglas McLean tells of how he was called up when war was declared and his posting to the 39th Brigade. He covers his years of service as well as fighting the Japanese in the Pacific.
description_for_label: Douglas McLean tells of how he was called up when war was declared and his posting to the 39th Brigade. He covers his years of service as well as fighting the Japanese in the Pacific.

results.title: Memories of a mate: an interview with Ivor White
results.brief_description: An emotional account by WWII veteran, Ivor White, about his involvement in the war in New Guinea and the tragic circumstances that brought about the death, on 14 July 1944, of his mate Jack Reynolds.
results.title_for_label: Memories of a mate: an interview with Ivor White

results.title: Contentment
results.creator_credit: Noel Atkinson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: A shearer for thirty years, Noel Atkinson’s life was turned upside down when he discovered he had Parkinson’s Disease. His new found passion in art and woodwork however has enabled him to live with this debilitating disease and provide comfort and strength in his everyday life.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Noel Atkinson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: A shearer for thirty years, Noel Atkinson’s life was turned upside down when he discovered he had Parkinson’s Disease. His new found passion in art and woodwork however has enabled him to live with this debilitating disease and provide comfort and strength in his everyday life.
description_for_label: A shearer for thirty years, Noel Atkinson’s life was turned upside down when he discovered he had Parkinson’s Disease. His new found passion in art and woodwork however has enabled him to live with this debilitating disease and provide comfort and strength in his everyday life.

results.title: Strong and Proud
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Darren Atkinson
results.brief_description: Darren grew up on Cummeragunja Mission and in this digital story he talks about his grandfather’s life, the Koori community and the handing down of Indigenous traditions and culture from one generation to the next.
results.description: Darren grew up on Cummeragunja Mission and in this digital story he talks about his grandfather’s life, the Koori community and the handing down of Indigenous traditions and culture from one generation to the next.
description_for_label: Darren grew up on Cummeragunja Mission and in this digital story he talks about his grandfather’s life, the Koori community and the handing down of Indigenous traditions and culture from one generation to the next.

results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Mick Booth

results.title: Leaving My Country
results.creator_credit: Grant Hood, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: An argument with his uncle one night would turn out to be a life-changing experience for Grant Hood, a proud Kurnai Gunai man. Grant mentions the importance of his meeting with Kutcha Edwards when he first arrives in Melbourne. A photo of a very young Kutcha is also shown.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Grant Hood, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: An argument with his uncle one night would turn out to be a life-changing experience for Grant Hood, a proud Kurnai Gunai man. Grant mentions the importance of his meeting with Kutcha Edwards when he first arrives in Melbourne. A photo of a very young Kutcha is also shown.
description_for_label: An argument with his uncle one night would turn out to be a life-changing experience for Grant Hood, a proud Kurnai Gunai man. Grant mentions the importance of his meeting with Kutcha Edwards when he first arrives in Melbourne. A photo of a very young Kutcha is also shown.

results.title: Remembering the past and looking forward to the future
results.creator_credit: Cuong Manh Pham, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: A story of escape by boat from Vietnam to a Malaysian refugee camp, and then to Australia in 1986 where Cuong Manh Pham eventually made a new life, reuniting with his family in 1990.
results.title_for_label: Remembering the past and looking forward to the future

results.title: A Journey to a new land
results.creator_credit: Tuan Anh Tran, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Leaving family and escaping from Vietnam in 1978 and eventually arriving in Australia by boat as a refugee, it would be six years before Tuan Anh Tran could finally be reunited with his family.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tuan Anh Tran, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.brief_description: Si Tuan Lieng and his wife are retirees and have recently made an overseas trip to China. In this story he talks about his life and family, their integration into Australian society since they left Vietnam over 26 years ago and highlights of their holiday in China.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI, ACMI Digital Storytelling and Si Tuan Lieng
